1039.question: what state of the accuracy did they obtain?
1039.response: {'Answer': 'The accuracies obtained vary across different tasks, models, and datasets. For the class-specific F-measures (Image 0), the accuracies are not explicit but shown as a bar graph for different views (v1-v8) across five class categories. For the AG News data set (Image 1), the accuracy graph suggests an accuracy of approximately 0.7 (70%) as it flattens on the y-axis. The Stanford Sentiment Treebank 5-class classification task (Image 2 & Image 3) shows accuracies ranging from 38.3% for SVM to 52.0

1040.question: what models did they compare to?
1040.response: {'Answer': 'They compared to n-grams TFIDF, n-grams, Lg. Lk. Convolution, 29 layers Convolution with KMaxPooling, Lg. Full Convolution, BoW, LSTM, Bag-of-means, high-order CNN, tree-LSTM, DRNN, DCNN, CNN-MC, NBoW, SVM, and several variations of MVN models.'}
1040.answer: High-order CNN, Tree-LSTM, DRNN, DCNN, CNN-MC, NBoW and SVM
